x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
Nonprofits handle thousands of financial transactions — donations, grants, salaries, and operational expenses — but most lack a unified and intelligent system to manage them. They rely on manual spreadsheets, disconnected accounting tools, or offline processes, leading to:
Human error in reporting and auditing
Fraud risks due to lack of verification and budget control
Difficulty linking financials to HR, procurement, and donations
Time-consuming reconciliations for every project or fund
The result is inefficient fund utilization, delayed reporting, and low donor transparency — which ultimately reduces trust and social impact.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

CapabilityUsage
App Engine StudioCore app creation for invoices, expenses, and ledgers
Flow DesignerApproval workflows and automated routing of invoices
Document IntelligenceExtract and verify invoice details automatically
Predictive IntelligenceForecast expenses, detect anomalies, and suggest optimizations
Integration HubConnect to Stripe / PayPal for donations and HR systems for payroll
UI BuilderFinancial dashboards and visual insights
Virtual Agent (optional)Query budgets, upcoming payments, and summaries
Performance AnalyticsTrack key KPIs like spend vs. budget or project cost trends

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Third-party APIs for:

  • Payment gateways (Stripe, PayPal, Razorpay)
  • Currency conversion (Open Exchange API)
  • Document intelligence engine (ServiceNow or external OCR if needed)
  • Data integration with HR and procurement modules (if connected)
  • Predictive model training for expense forecasting and anomaly detection

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Ensuring data security and privacy for financial records
  • Maintaining integration consistency across multiple modules and APIs
  • Designing a scalable approval hierarchy adaptable to different nonprofit sizes
  • Training smaller NGOs to adopt a digital finance system
  • Fine-tuning predictive models for varied NGO spending patterns

These challenges can be mitigated through modular design, access controls, and guided onboarding flows.
